page.title: 01Dundrennan and Area
page.content: Dundrennan is a small village in the county of Dumfries and Galloway,which is in S.W. Scotland. The village is about 3km from the coast and the nearest town is Kirkcudbright, 8km away which is reached by the A711. The most prominent building in Dundrennan is a ruined Cistercian Abbey founded in 1142,which attracts many tourists during the summer. The surrounding area is gently rolling,providing good farming land most of which is used for grazing. Travelling west towards Kirkcudbright the A711 borders the northern side of a Ministry of Defence Testing Range.
